description: Dive into "Florence: Love in Every Corner" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Florence: Love in Every Corner

places.generalDescription: Piazzale Michelangelo is a 19th-century square in Florence, featuring a bronze replica of Michelangelo's David and offering breathtaking panoramic views of the city. It's a popular spot for romantic dates, where visitors can enjoy the stunning bird's-eye view while sipping on wine and listening to musicians play favorites during sunset.

sources.snippet: The best place in town to propose is almost certainly Piazzale Michelangelo, the city‚Äôs most famous belvedere located on the top of a hill overlooking Florence. From here you can enjoy stunning vistas over the town and admire the most important buildings of Florence, such as the Duomo, Palazzo della Signoria and Ponte Vecchio. The presence of musicians playing live songs on the staircase will make your proposal simply perfect.
sources.shortName: 12 Romantic Spots To Propose In Florence

sources.snippet: The romantic weekend in Florence is an exclusive offer by the Brunelleschi Hotel which will allow you to discover the sweet essence of a timeless city, strolling through the ancient streets of the historic centre, enjoying the breathtaking views from the Brunelleschi‚Äôs Dome or Piazzale Michelangelo. Moreover, to live magic moments, we suggest you a sunset stroll along the Arno River and Ponte Vecchio and a visit to the Boboli Gardens, where time seems to stand still in the charm of the green.
sources.shortName: where to sleep and what to do

sources.snippet: Located on the top of a hill overlooking the entire city, The Duomo, Palazzo della Signoria, and Ponte Vecchio are all clearly visible, making it one of the most romantic places to bend the knee!. It is a bit far from all of the major tourist attractions, but it is definitely worth the trek to the top. Sometimes it can get crowded, so just around the corner is a great spot near Basilica San Miniato al Monte.
sources.shortName: Florence - Local Lens

sources.snippet: Here then are three walking routes you can follow to discover the heart of the historical center, the Oltrarno and Piazzale Michelangelo. Looking for an originale itinerary to inspire passion?. Read our itinerary on the footsteps of Dante and Beatrice.
sources.shortName: What to Do & See, Most Romantic Places in Florence

sources.snippet: Sunsets are one of the most romantic things to do as a couple. Where better to watch the sunset in Florence than high above the city at Piazzale Michelangelo. If you know us, you know Robyn loves a sunset.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Things To Do In Florence Italy in 2023

sources.snippet: After breakfast in one of Florence's historic pastry shops, head up to Piazzale Michelangelo for a breathtaking view of Florence.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places and itineraries in Florence

places.name: Piazzale Michelangelo

reviews.text: This place offers the best views of the city of Florence.  It is simply a must see by anyone visiting here.  If you have difficulty walking, highly recommend a taxi to the top as it is a brisk and demanding climb. Nonetheless, this is over is the most beautiful places in Florence where you can admire the sheer beauty of the area.

This was a walk worth taking. We thought about taxiing over but so glad we took the walk through the city instead because we squeezed in a tour of all the places on the way! The views from the Piazzale are spectacular! It was super crowded when we went but it was still awesome. We also checked out the little bar in the Rose Garden below the Piazzale‚Ä¶very cool. It was truly one of our favorite spots.

Amazing views of the sunset over Florence, the best pictures are taken during the 1 hour before sunset. Make sure to arrive early to choose a good seat higher up the stairs. Recommend taking some food and drink with you. There are toilets nearby but 1 euro charge to use them so bring cash just in case.

places.address: 50125 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: The Cathedral of Santa Maria del Fiore, also known as the Duomo of Florence, is a 1200s landmark featuring a red-tiled dome, colored marble facade, and elegant Giotto tower. Visiting this complex allows you to experience multiple must-see sights in one go.

sources.snippet: Make sure to add to your list the "must-see classics" of the Cathedral of Santa Maria del Fiore and the Baptistery. Both will leave you breathless!
sources.shortName: What to Do & See, Most Romantic Places in Florence
The most romantic places and itineraries in Florence

places.name: Cathedral of Santa Maria del Fiore

reviews.text:
An inspiring experience at the Duomo in Florence, it was truly breathtaking! The stunning architecture, intricate details, and rich history left us in awe. Loved the history and beauty of italian history.
The property itself is a masterpiece of Renaissance architecture, with the terracotta-tiled dome designed by Filippo Brunelleschi being a highlight. The intricate marble facades, stunning stained-glass windows, and ornate sculptures added to the overall grandeur of the complex. A must see beauty of art and history.
Encourage visiting the Duomo, especially with a guided tour, to appreciate its beauty, history, and significance. It's an experience that will leave you with lasting memories of Florence magnificent beauty.

Absolutely beautiful, the cathedral looked amazing and it was very grandiose.

I loved to see the use of colors that they applied. You really cannot grasp just how big the cathedral and the dome are until you stand close to it. Heck we were even able to see it from when our plane was going to land.

The outside of the building is a sight to be hold superb and worth the visit alone.
The inside not so much quite bland for such a huge building. The fresco on the ceiling is wonderful
Plus if you want to see climb the dome or the bell tower it's extra charges as is the crypt.To see the check on site and book well in advance .
Advisable to book in advance to visit the cathedral inside

places.address: Piazza del Duomo, 50122 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: The Uffizi Galleries, located just a short stroll from the iconic Ponte Vecchio, is a 16th-century building that houses an extensive collection of Primitive and Renaissance paintings and masterpieces. This renowned museum welcomes over two million visitors annually who come to admire ancient sculptures and historic paintings spanning from the Middle Ages to modern times.

sources.snippet: The ‚ÄúGalleria degli Uffizi‚Äù is one of the most famous museums in the world that was actually never meant to be a museum. Cosimo I de‚Äô Medici planned to accommodate the offices of the Florentine magistrates in the building but, over the years, more and more sections of the palace were recruited to exhibit numerous paintings and sculptures that were collected or commissioned by the Medici family. Today, there are more than 50 rooms filled with incredible artworks, mostly from the period of the Italian Renaissance.
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to do in Florence at Night

sources.snippet: The Uffizi Gallery and the Accademia Gallery are undoubtedly the most famous and you especially cannot miss visiting them if you are in Florence for the very first time. Keep in mind, however, that these museums are also among the most visited and that there are often long queues to enter. An hour long line is not very romantic!.
sources.shortName: What to Do & See, Most Romantic Places in Florence

sources.snippet: The Uffizi Gallery is home to some of the world‚Äôs most beautiful and famous paintings, sculptures and works of art. The museum houses works by famous artists such as Leonardo da Vinci, Michelangelo, Botticelli and many others. It is truly a sight to behold.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places of Florence Italy: 3 days itinerary

sources.snippet: The Uffizi Gallery contains the most famous nude of the Florentine Renaissance: Botticelli's Birth of Venus . Gazing at the goddess of Love rising out of the waters, you might be inspired toward your own romantic Florence experience.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Florence

sources.snippet: The Uffizi is one of the most spectacular art museums in the world. It‚Äôs filled with the works of Italian Renaissance artists and the building is spectacular. Propose and Capture here!
sources.shortName: Florence - Local Lens

sources.snippet: With your ticket already booked, visit the Uffizi Gallery, where you will be fascinated by the masterpieces of Botticelli, Michelangelo and Caravaggio.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places and itineraries in Florence

places.name: Uffizi Galleries

reviews.text: We bought tickets a couple of months before our visit and got them for the earliest time slot possible. Even doing this, I recommend arriving as early as possible. We got to the entrance 15 minutes before the museum opened and there was already a line. That being said, the museum is huge and early in the morning crowds weren't bad at all! We ran right upstairs to the Botticelli rooms, and got to have them all to ourselves. Absolutely amazing. Everything in this museum from the architecture to the artwork itself is beautiful.

Visiting the Uffizi Gallery was a dream come true. I love Tuscany and the Renaissance, and being in the Uffizi Gallery and seeing the works of famous Renaissance artists was like a dream. I had to pinch myself every now and then to remind myself that I was awake and that I was really in the Uffizi Gallery. We were visiting in May, so it was crowded, but I didn't notice it at all, as I was excited and enchanted by the visit and the whole experience. Seeing Botticelli's Primavera and Birth of Venus and Raphael's Madonna of the Goldfinch were experiences in themselves. And when I saw Artemisia Gentileschi's Judith Beheading Holofernes was the icing on the cake. The works of some of my favorite artists in one place and seeing them live was a privilege and an experience that I will always remember. As there was a crowd, we did wait a bit to get in, mostly due to strict security, and it took us approx 15 to 20 min which is completly normal for the time of the month and the popularty of Uffizi. We did have Firenzecard so we only had to book an appoitment for Uffizi Gallery which we did 2 days before the visit so we did save some time. And we also took an appoitment in the morning hours which was a great decison as the crowd got bigger the longer the visit went. You will need several hours for the visit and to not hurry through the gallery, so my advice plan your time well. We took our time to enjoy our visit so were in Uffizi from 09:30 until 12:45. Anyone planning to stay in Tuscany and Florence for more then one or two days, I highly recommend to get the Firenzacard. Makes visits to palazzo, museums and galleries that much easier and pleasent.

An absolutely breathtaking experience! I was so impressed by the incredible collection of famous artworks, and learning about the Medici family's background and legacy made it even more fascinating. Every room holds masterpieces that deserve hours of attention-honestly, even a lifetime wouldn't be enough to truly take in all the details. I only wish I had more time to explore! Plus it was very interesting to see famous Ottoman portraits up there on the ceiling as a Turkish.

places.address: Piazzale degli Uffizi, 6, 50122 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: In the heart of Florence, Italy, stands the Basilica of Santa Maria Novella, a 15th-century Dominican church renowned for its stunning frescoes by Gothic and early Renaissance masters. Situated on the northern side of the river, this area is home to some of Florence's major attractions.

sources.snippet: Near the Church of Santa Maria Novella, you‚Äôll find a 600-year-old small pharmacy. Formerly run by Dominican monks, it‚Äôs one of the oldest pharmacies in the world!. You can buy perfumes, soaps and other skin-care products, prepared by following centuries-old recipes.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do in Florence (My Top List 2021)

places.name: Basilica of Santa Maria Novella

reviews.text:
Hidden gem in Bergamo.
One of the most beautiful churches I've ever visited. Incredible art, detailed interiors, and a quiet atmosphere. Don't miss the wooden choir stalls!

May 2025. Seems to be one of the major church destinations in Florence. Conveniently located near the train station. Another case of me liking the exterior more. The interior is still worth visiting though.

Stunning building from the outside.
But I was a little underwhelmed inside. Apart from the fresco  which was the was the highlight.If you want to climb the bell tower or the dome and go down the crypt you have to pay extra.
Check well in advance if you want to climb the dome.It does get busy.

places.address: P.za di Santa Maria Novella, 18, 50123 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Palazzo Pitti is a grand Renaissance royal palace in Florence that houses an extensive collection of Italian and European masterpieces. It comprises six museums, including the Palatine Gallery, which boasts twenty-eight rooms filled with late Renaissance and Baroque art by renowned artists such as Raphael, Andrea del Sarto, Rubens, and Tintoretto. The Gallery of Modern Art offers a stunning display of artworks within the former residence of the Lorraine family on the second floor of the palace.

sources.snippet: Doesn‚Äôt each couple envision being a ruler and princess or lord and ruler?. Strolling through the royal residence and seeing where the regal families used to live is an amazing background!. Interestingly, you can thump this out with the Boboli Gardens as the nurseries are basically the back yard of the Pitti Palace.
sources.siteName: Explore the World with Adequate Travel - Your One-Stop Destination for Travel Planning-adequatetravel.com
sources.shortName: Best Romantic Things to do in Florence with your Partner
What to Do & See, Most Romantic Places in Florence

sources.snippet: Located behind Palazzo Pitti, the Boboli Gardens is truly a stop not to be missed. The full ticket costs ‚Ç¨10
sources.shortName: Valentine's Day in Florence: the most romantic places

places.name: Palazzo Pitti

reviews.text:
We recently had the chance to visit the stunning Palazzo Pitti and its breathtaking Galleria Palatina in Florence.

The exterior already impresses with its bold Renaissance symmetry and monumental scale ‚Äì but stepping inside is like entering a different world. Lavishly decorated rooms, dazzling chandeliers, and finely detailed ceilings create a royal atmosphere that leaves you speechless. Every space is filled with precious artworks, marble sculptures, and golden frames that catch the light in magical ways.

The gallery itself is a treasure trove of Italian masters ‚Äì Raphael, Titian, Caravaggio ‚Äì displayed in opulent halls that reflect the taste and power of the Medici and beyond. It's more than a museum. It's an experience of beauty, history, and magnificence woven together.

Take your time, look up often ‚Äì and let this place transport you.

Enjoy your stay here and have a fantastic time! üëã

We only had about two hours spare and we chose to see the Modern Art exhibit‚Ä¶ not modern art as one would normally expect to see‚Ä¶ modern Italian art (1700s- early 1900s) would be more accurate. On a very hot day, it was a refuge from the sun and if we had more time, it would have been good to see more!

Sweet place to see, ornamental ceilings, and lots of amazing art. Get the combined 5 day ticket with Uffizi if you want to save some coin, let's you see the palace and gardens combined alongside an amazing gallery. Docking one point because the proximity sensors in the modern art gallery section were so sensitive, sometimes you don't know what even set the alarm off.

places.address: Piazza de' Pitti, 1, 50125 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Ponte Vecchio is a charming medieval bridge with a rich history dating back to Roman times. It is renowned for its unique shops selling jewelry and souvenirs. On the northern side of the river, visitors can explore major Florence attractions such as the Duomo, Giotto's Bell Tower, Piazza della Signoria, Basilica of Santa Maria Novella, and more. The bridge has endured significant events throughout history including reconstruction after a devastating flood and surviving World War II.

sources.snippet: Ponte Vecchio is one of the most charming spots for proposals in town but in winter time and preferably after sunset; during the spring and summer days it‚Äôs always very crowded and it won‚Äôt be easy to get the job done. But if you are lucky enough to be in town at a quiet time, you can‚Äôt miss the chance to propose to your partner in one of the most ancient and famous spots of Florence. https://www.instagram.com/p/BZ22IU7ATKj/?
sources.shortName: 12 Romantic Spots To Propose In Florence

sources.snippet: The exceptional Signorvino Restaurant is, hands down, the dreamiest place to make someone weak at the knees. This sublime and handsome venue in Florence is a go-to staple for exquisite dining experiences followed by astounding views of the city of Renaissance, the Old Bridge, and the ravishing Ponte Vecchio, which is just a few steps further down the road. If you manage to get a hold of yourself and take your eyes away from the gorgeous and incredibly romantic panoramas, you will realise that Signorvino also has an impressive wine list.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Florence to Keep the Spark Alive ‚Äì Kinglike

sources.snippet: If you are new married couple and Come to Florence for a Honeymoon, want to spend your time at a romantic place then I will suggest the most Romantic Place in Florence that you should visit with your partner. This is one of Florence‚Äôs best-known landmarks and it is therefore very visited and swarmed. On ends of the week and high-season, it won‚Äôt be anything but difficult to make the most of its magnificence in quietness.
sources.siteName: Explore the World with Adequate Travel - Your One-Stop Destination for Travel Planning-adequatetravel.com
sources.shortName: Best Romantic Things to do in Florence with your Partner

sources.snippet: Ponte Vecchio is a beautiful Medieval stone closed-spandrel segmental arch bridge over the Arno River, in Florence. The bridge is an ideal setting to spend a romantic evening, hand in hands with your loved one, right above the pristine waters of Arno River. Your trip to Florence is incomplete as long as you do not take a visit as this charming spot in the city.
sources.shortName: Romantic Places to Visit in Florence

sources.snippet: This stone arch bridge was the first one built in the city and some of its shops have been there since the 13th-century. Ponte Vecchio can get a bit crowded, so if you want a Florence proposal with this iconic bridge, we recommend popping the question on the bridge right next to it, Ponte Santa Trinita!. Propose and Capture here!
sources.shortName: Florence - Local Lens

sources.snippet: Imagine spending unforgettable moments with your love strolling the streets of the historic center of Florence, probably stopping to admire the splendid Piazza della Signoria, the stunning Ponte Vecchio, or seeing Botticelli's Primavera from upclose and Michelangelo's David. Are you already looking for plane tickets?
sources.shortName: What to Do & See, Most Romantic Places in Florence

sources.snippet: Imagine spending unforgettable moments with your love strolling the streets of the historic centre of Florence, probably stopping to admire the splendid Piazza della Signoria, the stunning Ponte Vecchio, or seeing Botticelli‚Äôs Primavera from up close and Michelangelo‚Äôs David.
sources.shortName: Planning the Perfect Romantic Florence Honeymoon

sources.snippet: Arno River is crossed by a few scenic stone bridges, as the most famous one is Ponte Vecchio. You‚Äôll probably pass along it a few times a day while exploring the city. And although the views are lovely during the day, I‚Äôd advise you to return to the area at sunset.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do in Florence (My Top List 2021)

sources.snippet: Along Ponte Vecchio there are the best jewellers in the city. You could surprise your other half with the most enchanting engagement ring or if you prefer not to rush too much‚Ä¶ have a ‚Äúcouple‚Äù portrait done in front of the Duomo or in front of the Uffizi Gallery.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places of Florence Italy: 3 days itinerary

sources.snippet: The iconic Ponte Vecchio has witnessed countless love stories throughout history. Allow our private transfer to transport you to this romantic masterpiece. As you cross the bridge, gaze into each other‚Äôs eyes and soak in the atmosphere of eternal romance.
sources.siteName: RomeCabs Transfers and Tours in Italy (Rome Cabs)
sources.shortName: 7 Romantic Places in Florence: Unveiling A Lover‚Äôs Paradise

sources.snippet: Spanning across the Arno River, the Ponte Vecchio is a stunning bridge. It is one of the most popular tourist destinations in the city, but it is easy to see why!. Built in the 13th century and rebuilt in 1557, the bridge holds so much history.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Things To Do In Florence Italy in 2023

sources.snippet: Today, Florence is a safe haven for the happiness of modern lovers to seek their own joyous ending: waiting for a sunset on the Ponte Vecchio, enjoying the gentle romantic hills of Fiesole, or along the panoramic hill on San Miniato al Monte.
sources.shortName: Romantic Valentines' Day in Florence

sources.snippet: Another romantic place in Florence is certainly Ponte Vecchio. As one of the symbols of Florence, it is somewhere you can only dream of seeing the sunset.
sources.shortName: Romantic Holiday in Florence

sources.siteName: Boho and Salty | Endless Honeymoon Destinations for Luxury and Sustainable Travel
sources.shortName: Romantic Weekend In Florence, Italy - Boho And Salty

places.name: Ponte Vecchio

reviews.text:
Lovely place to stroll, lots of jewelry shops located on the bridge itself. Can get very crowded but worthwhile for looking around.

The views from there are nice too.

Such a huge joy to be able to enjoy this hugely popular and unique bridge in person. Despite looking very busy with jewelries shops and tourists, it still managed to look pretty peaceful from within the apartments. I believe something as unique as this should only be admired from distance.

This is such a Beautiful bridge with amazing shops on and all around the area, this is a great place for sunsets, shopping and watching an occasional musician. I hated to leave Firenze. Love this bridge and the beautiful people of Florence Italy. ‚ù§Ô∏èüíê

places.address: 50125 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Basilica di San Miniato is a stunning 11th-century church located on a hilltop in Florence, offering breathtaking city views. It is renowned for its gleaming Romanesque facade and medieval interiors, making it one of the most exquisite examples of Romanesque architecture in Tuscany. Visitors can explore the church and the adjacent Olivetan monastery for free, although access may be challenging for those with limited mobility.

sources.snippet: With its breathtaking views of Florence and serene Romanesque architecture, this place provides a romantic and intimate setting for a wedding proposal. Its tranquil atmosphere and stunning backdrop create the perfect moment for a memorable "yes.". Propose and Capture here!
sources.shortName: Florence - Local Lens

places.name: Basilica di San Miniato

reviews.text:
Located above the Piazza Michelangelo this church has a great view.  The cemetery is beautiful and many of the monuments feature recognizable names. Inside the church has an understated grace that still inspires awe. All in all a lovely visit and a
recommended stop.

The church was undergoing repair in February 2025 and the front facade and part of the nave was scaffolded. The architect and contractor are maintaining public access and in fact are providing exemplary information boards about the work and offering occasional conducted tours.
The church is impressive inside and out and learning how the fabric is being repaired is fascinating.
The work will go on for many months.
May 2025. Arguably a better view than Piazzale Michelangelo. The church itself is probably very nice, but it was under heavy renovation when we visited.

places.address: Via delle Porte Sante, 34, 50125 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Ponte Santa Trinita, also known as St Trinity Bridge, is a charming old stone bridge in Florence that crosses the River Arno. It was designed by Bartolomeo Ammanati and reconstructed after World War II. The bridge is adorned with lovely statues and is surrounded by two other stone bridges, Ponte Alla Carraia and the famous Ponte Vecchio.

sources.snippet: There is nothing more romantic than an evening stroll along the Arno river admiring the lights reflecting on the water. For stunning views over the river and Ponte Vecchio, the perfect spot is Ponte Santa Trinita, which is one of the most famous bridges in Florence. https://www.instagram.com/p/BZjizCOne8o/?
sources.shortName: 12 Romantic Spots To Propose In Florence

sources.snippet: Ponte Santa Trinita (St Trinity Bridge) is a Romantic Place in Florence which is one of the excellent old stone extensions that traverse the River Arno in Florence. Lovely statues remain on the two sides and there are 2 other stone scaffolds ‚Äì to be specific Ponte Alla Carraia and the more well known Ponte Vecchio ‚Äì around it. Ponte Santa Trinita is especially prevalent for grand strolls and, being the center of the 3 excellent intersections, it fills in as an incredible perspective for catching the riverscape, just as for taking in the emotional dusk over Florence.
sources.siteName: Explore the World with Adequate Travel - Your One-Stop Destination for Travel Planning-adequatetravel.com
sources.shortName: Best Romantic Things to do in Florence with your Partner

sources.snippet: The Santa Tr√¨nita Bridge is one of the historic bridges in Florence that crosses the Arno and stands out from all the others for the elegance of its arches and for the four allegorical statues that adorn its ends, depicting the seasons. Positioned between Ponte alla Carraia and Ponte Vecchio, it enjoys a privileged view of the city and the other bridges, in particular of Ponte Vecchio, which, with its ancient silhouette and its thousand-year history, becomes the privileged protagonist of this wonder.
sources.shortName: Valentine's Day in Florence: the most romantic places

sources.snippet: The Ponte Santa Trinita is a beautiful bridge which spans the Arno River. First built in the 13 th Century with the current version rebuilt by the wealthy Medici family in 1557, the Ponte Santa Trinita is an old bridge with a rich history of its own. With its distinct arches and Capricorn statues (each representing one of the four seasons) it offers lovely views of the famous Ponte Vecchio (the old bridge) without the crowds.
sources.shortName: 10 Utterly Romantic Things to Do in Florence

sources.snippet: Ponte Santa Trinita is one of the historic bridges that cross the Arno in the center of Florence. Adorned at the ends by four allegorical statues that symbolize the seasons, it is located between two other famous bridges: Ponte alla Carraia and Ponte Vecchio. Thanks to its privileged position, it is a perfect place to take memorable photos and admire the sun setting over Florence.
sources.shortName: 10 romantic things to do in Florence for Valentine's Day

sources.snippet: And don‚Äôt miss to stop at Ponte Santa Trinita and Ponte Alla Carraia to enjoy some great views of Ponte Vecchio.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do in Florence (My Top List 2021)
The most romantic places in Florence
Planning the Perfect Romantic Getaway in Florence

places.name: Ponte Santa Trinita

reviews.text: The bridge is often considered the most elegant and architecturally refined stone bridge spanning the Arno River, representing the height of Renaissance bridge design. Notably, it is the world's first elliptical arch bridge, composed of three shallow elliptical arches. Originally built as a wooden bridge in 1252, it was reconstructed in stone after a flood in 1333. After collapsing again in 1557, the current version was built between 1567 and 1571, commissioned by Cosimo I de' Medici and designed by Bartolomeo Ammannati. Destroyed in 1944 during World War II, the bridge was meticulously rebuilt in 1958 using the original materials and plans. At night, the softly lit arches reflected in the river create a picture-perfect, romantic scene.

Views are amazing! The first time I visited I went at sunset time and it was very crowded but it's still beautiful. The second time I woke up for sunrise and I was literally the only one overlooking at both of the bridges. So lucky to be here! üåÅ üåÑ üáÆüáπ

Elegantly arched, timeless beauty over the Arno
This Renaissance masterpiece, designed by Bartolomeo Ammannati (with Michelangelo's possible input), was built between 1567‚Äì1569 on the site of older medieval bridges  . It holds the title of the world's oldest elliptical‚Äëarch bridge, featuring three flattened arches (29‚ÄØm outer spans, 32‚ÄØm center) meticulously carved from limestone  .

places.address: 50100 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Palazzo Vecchio, originally built to house the city's government officials and later transformed into the Medici family's residence, is a 13th-century fortified palace in Florence. It boasts lavishly decorated chambers, ornate courtyards, and a towering presence atop the Piazza della Signoria. Inside, visitors can explore secret passages, admire frescoed ceilings, and marvel at well-preserved artworks that offer insight into Florence's rich history under powerful families like the Medici dynasty.

sources.snippet: Take a walk right after the sunset and see the most beautiful parts of the Tuscan capital. You will be enchanted by the beauty of Palazzo Vecchio, the town hall of Florence built between the 13th and 14th century. It keeps amazing masterpieces by Michelangelo, Vasari, and Da Vinci.
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to do in Florence at Night

sources.snippet: After a hearty breakfast at one of the historic cafes, such as Caff√® Gilli or Caff√® Concerto Paszkowski, we suggest you start your day in Piazza della Signoria, just 200 meters from FH55 Hotel Calzaiuoli, to admire Palazzo Vecchio and the statues that adorn it.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places and itineraries in Florence

sources.snippet: The Uffizi Gallery is home to some of the world‚Äôs most beautiful and famous paintings, sculptures and works of art. The museum houses works by famous artists such as Leonardo da Vinci, Michelangelo, Botticelli and many others. It is truly a sight to behold.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places of Florence Italy: 3 days itinerary

sources.snippet: On Valentine's Day it will be possible to go up on the walkways of the Arnolfo Tower, the top of Palazzo Vecchio. For this event a romantic toast under the stars will also be included.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places in Florence
What to Do & See, Most Romantic Places in Florence

places.name: Palazzo Vecchio

reviews.text: Ma favorite place in Firenze, always! I love the Palazzo Vecchio as it's very quiet and not so crowded compared to other famous places in Firenze or Italy. I also love the fact that there are some signs and descriptions in each room to explain the purpose of the room and the paintings and other objects inside the rooms. The staff working there is very nice and helpful too.

Went by but didn't go inside, just looked around the free parts. The building is cool and has a lot of history, but mostly felt like a tourist spot. Worth a quick look if you're already in the area, but nothing I'd plan around.

Really cool to see the amazing art displayed on the walls inside the hall. Walking inside not knowing what I would see just to be amazed by the craftsmanship. I would recommend it for any one coming for art and history, but if your not much into art and have visited alot of museums throughout the day then it won't be worth it for you. However for my friends and I enjoyed visiting and seeing this place.

places.address: P.za della Signoria, 50122 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Basilica di San Lorenzo, a landmark Renaissance church in Florence, is known as the burial place of the Medici family. The church features an unfinished facade designed by Michelangelo and a library he also designed. It was originally built in the 4th century and later transformed into a magnificent Renaissance building by Filippo Brunelleschi from 1377 to 1446. Inside, visitors can admire Brunelleschi's Sagrestia Vecchia with sculptural decoration by Donatello.

sources.snippet: On your way back, pass by the Basilica of San Lorenzo and then head to the Mercato Centrale to sample some of its specialties.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places and itineraries in Florence

places.name: Basilica di San Lorenzo

reviews.text: A very beautiful basilica, both the main building and the crypt which hosts a small museum of sorts. Some stunning murals and sculptures. Not too crowded.

Pretty disappointing I thought.  For 9 euros I was expecting something pretty spectacular but it is nothing exceptional.  I thought the courtyard was the best part.  The basement isn't a crypt but a museum of altar pieces and robes.  There is a toilet in the bookstore (off the courtyard) that costs 1 euro but it only takes 1 and 2 euro coins.  Just duck under the turnstile to get in.

Trivia - The front of the building looks odd since it is the back wall to a marble facade that was never added.

The Basilica di San Lorenzo (Basilica of St. Lawrence) is one of the largest churches of Florence, Italy, situated at the centre of the main market district of the city, and it is the burial place of all the principal members of the Medici family from Cosimo il Vecchio to Cosimo III. It is one of several churches that claim to be the oldest in Florence, having been consecrated in 393 AD,[1] at which time it stood outside the city walls. For three hundred years it was the city's cathedral, before the official seat of the bishop was transferred to Santa Reparata.

San Lorenzo was the parish church of the Medici family. In 1419, Giovanni di Bicci de' Medici offered to finance a new church to replace an eleventh-century Romanesque rebuilding. Filippo Brunelleschi, the leading Renaissance architect of the first half of the fifteenth century, was commissioned to design it, but the building, with alterations, was not completed until after his death. The church is part of a larger monastic complex that contains other important architectural and artistic works: the Old Sacristy (Sagresta Vecchia) by Brunelleschi and having interior decoration and sculpture by Donatello; the Laurentian Library by Michelangelo; the Medici Chapels, two structures that include the New Sacristy (Sagrestia Nuova) based on Michelangelo's designs; and the larger Cappella dei Principi ("Chapel of the Princes") being a collaboration between the family and architects.

places.address: Piazza di San Lorenzo, 9, 50123 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: The Museo Nazionale del Bargello is an art museum housed in a 13th-century palace, showcasing Renaissance sculptures including works by Michelangelo. Located in the eastern area between Piazza Duomo and Piazza della Signoria, it is surrounded by medieval features such as Palazzo del Bargello, Badia Fiorentina monastery, Palazzo Gondi, and Palazzo Pazzi.

sources.shortName: What to Do & See, Most Romantic Places in Florence

places.name: Museo Nazionale del Bargello

reviews.text: The Museo Nazionale del Bargello is worth visiting when in Florence. It is not as busy as the Ufizzi Galleries and houses masterpieces by Donatello and Michelangelo, amongst others.  There is a wonderful and peaceful courtyard where you can sit, relax and ponder.

We visited this museum and it was beautiful. The exhibits were mostly statues and busts, sprinkled with lots of items from antiquity. The museum is on three levels and is structured as a fort with an internal courtyard. There is an elevator to take you to all levels and lots of work by the artist Donatello. The museum is in the heart of the city right in the centre which was also nice.

Very nice museum, worth visiting for the beautiful sculptures alone. Though I sometimes did not understand the English translation of the information boards because of some linguistic errors. Updating/improving them would maybe help with understanding the history and the art.

places.address: Via del Proconsolo, 4, 50122 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Immerse yourself in the authentic Italian culinary experience with Pasta Class Florence. Join passionate and knowledgeable local chefs like Marco and Davide for a fun and engaging cooking session where you'll learn to make pasta and other favorite dishes. The family-friendly atmosphere allows children to get involved, creating a memorable experience for everyone. The classes are professionally set up, providing an opportunity to not only learn about pasta making but also gain insights into Italian heritage and culture.

sources.snippet: Unlike our other romantic things to do in Florence, Italy, a cooking class is definitely a team bonding experience. Rather than sitting enjoying the view with a glass of wine, taking part in a cooking class together is a lovely way to spend an afternoon. We took part in a pasta-making class we found on Airbnb.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Things To Do In Florence Italy in 2023

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs time to test your Italian culinary skills in a real cooking school!. This exciting experience will be even more interesting with your partner, as you can cook a meal for each other. You will spend around 4 hours in a lovely classic building and prepare a traditional Tuscan 4-course dinner.
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to do in Florence at Night

places.name: Pasta Class Florence | Cooking classes in Florence

reviews.text: One of our favorite tours while in Florence. The class was full and we were contacted ahead of time to inform us of a new venue near the river that fit everyone. We had no issues with the location change and found ourselves close by to a handy Florence wine window as well. Our chef for the class was Victoria and she was so much fun! Her instructions were easy to follow as she walked us through making 3 different types of pasta, tortellini, ravioli and a wider noodle similar to fettuccini. She stopped by every single persons station to help with any troubles and provided much needed encouragement to those of us on the struggle bus. There was unlimited wine available for the course and following our noodle making process she immediately demonstrated how to complete the meal letting us eat our creations for better or worse. If you have the time and find yourself in Florence, this is a must-do class, if you are lucky enough to have Victoria as your chef, even better!!

My wife and I just took the Pasta Class Florence and Chef Andrea made the whole experience unforgettable! he's not only a skilled chef, but also incredibly welcoming, funny, and just a great guy to spend a night with. We had such a blast learning how to make fresh pasta from scratch, and the hands-on approach made it feel like we were cooking with a friend rather than taking a class.

What really stood out was how generous he was with his knowledge. He didn't just teach us recipes, he gave us tips and recommendations for places to eat and explore all across Italy. Also made sure our glasses were full!

Truly a memory we'll carry with us for the rest of our lives. Thank you, Chef Andrea, for making our honeymoon even more special.

My husband and I had a fabulous time on a rainy afternoon while attending this class with nine other participants. The set up was cozy both at a long counter surrounding a stove where our Chef prepared sauces for our pasta and at a large wooden table where we all made three kinds of pasta. Chef Davide was so very informative and entertaining. He put us all at ease and the three hours flew by with a very happy ending of eating our work! I feel I have learned a skill I can repeat and had great fun learning. Highly recommend!!

places.address: Piazza Lorenzo Ghiberti, 4/r, 50122 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Campanile di Giotto is a renowned Gothic tower in Florence, Italy. It stands at 85 meters tall and is adorned with red, green, and white marble. The tower offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city from its terrace. Situated in Piazza del Duomo, it is part of the major attractions in northern Florence along with the Duomo and Piazza della Signoria.

sources.snippet: Like the climb of the Duomo, the Campanile di Giotto is a spot for energetic proposals. From here you can admire the Duomo too, making it one of the most panoramic viewpoints in the whole city. https://www.instagram.com/p/BXOKVa6hAaL/?
sources.shortName: 12 Romantic Spots To Propose In Florence

sources.snippet: Set among the 13th-century turrets surrounded by all the shades and sights of a unique city, The Tower serves up the very best of local produce, from fish freshly caught off the Tuscan coast to Chianina beef and hand-picked saffron as well as dairy products from renowned farms such as Il Palagiaccio.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Restaurants in Florence for Moments of Intense Intimacy

places.name: Giotto's Bell Tower

reviews.text:
Giotto's Campanile is one of the most iconic structures in Florence's skyline and a must-visit for anyone exploring the city. Part of the Cathedral complex, this 14th-century bell tower was begun by the renowned artist and architect Giotto di Bondone in 1334 and completed after his death.
Be sure to book your tickets online in advance, as entrance is limited and demand is high, especially during peak season. Without a reservation, it's unlikely you'll get in.
The climb to the top involves more than 400 narrow steps-there's no elevator, and the staircase can feel quite tight, which may be challenging for some. But the reward at the top is simply stunning: a panoramic view over Florence that includes an unbeatable close-up of Brunelleschi's dome.
Aside from the view, the tower itself is a masterpiece of Gothic architecture. The intricate exterior features polychrome marble panels and detailed decorations that deserve close attention. A physically demanding visit, but without a doubt worth every step.

Giotto's Bell Tower is one of the highlights of Florence ‚Äì the architecture is stunning up close, and climbing it is a great experience. The staircase is quite narrow and steep, but manageable if you take your time. The effort is well worth it for the panoramic views over the Duomo and the city!

Absolutely must visit!!

One of the best places in Florence to visit, actually the top one and the great example of Florentine Gothic architecture of 14th century, designed by Giotto. You need to buy a ticket/pass to access the tower. Better to buy online as the tickets are sold months ahead. Access to the Bell Tower is only possible during designated time slots, and entry must follow the scheduled timing- there is no independent access allowed. There is no elevator, and the climb involves 414 steps where 2 people in some parts can barely pass. It's not recommended for individuals with heart conditions, vertigo, or claustrophobia. But the view from the top of almost 85m high tower is rewarding and worth all the sweat from climbing the stairs. You have 45min to climb up -admire the view and descend. The guards will move everyone out in time to get back down.

places.address: Piazza del Duomo, 43¬∞46'22"N 11¬∞15'20"E, 50122 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: The Medici Riccardi Palace, a 15th-century mansion designed by Michelozzo for the Medici family, is now home to an art museum and a famous chapel. The palace hosts an exhibition featuring works by Italian artist Oscar Ghiglia, known for his ties to Tuscany and European artistic developments. The palace's architecture stands out with its arched windows, partially shuttered loggia, rusticated floors, and large cornice capping the roofline.

sources.snippet: Dazzled by the marbles of Santa Maria del Fiore, dazzled by the flaming bricks of Palazzo Vecchio, you can get lost and find yourself in an unexpected Florence. Turning the corner there is another world, another time that shakes our emotional center of gravity, making us live an extraordinary experience, truly romantic. Discover here a city to explore strictly on foot.
sources.shortName: 10 romantic things to do in Florence for Valentine's Day

places.name: Medici Riccardi Palace

reviews.text: An underrated must-see: the visit may be fairly short but some of the art is really worth the detour, in particular the absolutely stunning ceiling by Luca Giordano, which ended up one of my favourites of the city. Also, the absence of crowds is a nice change.

Very much enjoyed this place.  Was quiet and really got to savour and experience old Florence, but with all the modern convenience.
Staff were very friendly and helpful.
Beautiful courtyard as you go in
Useful locker to leave your bag and enjoy your stay more... (Ufizzi Take note!!)
Inner courtyard is lovely too and there is a little garden outside with some wonderful ancient wisteria.
Spent an hour there, which is enough but took plenty in.  You can stay longer if you want to go into detail but the general vibe is artistic,  stately and  beautiful.

I had the opportunity to visit the Medici Palace in Florence and it is definitely a place worth seeing. I chose a guided tour and truly recommend it ‚Äì thanks to that we learned many interesting stories and anecdotes about the Medici family and life in Renaissance Florence.

The palace itself is truly impressive ‚Äì both with its architecture and the richness of its interiors. It hides many fascinating objects, and the atmosphere takes you back to the city's golden age. An absolute must-see for anyone visiting Florence.

places.address: Via Camillo Cavour, 3, 50129 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Basilica di Santo Spirito, a 15th-century church in Florence, is a prime example of Renaissance architecture. Designed by Brunelleschi, the church features a plain facade but boasts an opulent interior adorned with art and a baroque altar. The grand scale of the nave, lined with grey sandstone columns, creates a serene atmosphere. Nearby is Chiesa di Orsanmichele, known for its fourteen tabernacles decorated by Florentine artists.

sources.snippet: When you are finished, you can continue at the Basilica di Santo Spirito, an uncrowded basilica that offers a peaceful atmosphere.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places and itineraries in Florence

places.name: Basilica di Santo Spirito

reviews.text:
The Basilica of the Holy Spirit was designed by Filippo Brunelleschi in the Renaissance style, who worked on it until his death in 1446.
The interior is relatively minimal, except for the Baroque baldachin with polychrome marble added in 1601.
The octagonal sacristy was added by Giuliano da Sangallo in 1489 and holds Michelangelo's Crucifix. Michelangelo, when he was 17 years old, was allowed to make anatomical studies on the corpses coming from the convent's hospital; in exchange, he sculpted a wooden crucifix which reflected what he learned about anatomy.
Need to pay the entrance fee to see Michelangelo's Crucifix, because the sacristy it's in is also quite nice.

It is not as popular as many other places but I think the most original church in Florence is Santo Spirito. It has an incredible atmosphere. There is an intertwined altar section/altar/mihrab inside. It is worth seeing just for that. It had a very different design. I was very impressed. The house was right in the center of the church. Moreover, it was free. There is also a statue of Jesus made by Michelangelo inside. This part is a separate place and you can enter here for 2‚Ç¨. I definitely recommend it. See it.
Also the backyard is a wonderful place. The lemon trees, lotus and fish were wonderful. We were literally the only ones in a place like Florence. It was a wonderful experience to discover this church which is very plain from the outside but wonderful inside. It needs some maintenance.
Very plain on the outside, but a wealth of history inside. Some fantastic altar pieces and a crucifixion carving and gardens.

places.address: Piazza Santo Spirito, 30, 50125 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: The Baptistery of St. John is an iconic octagonal basilica in Florence, known for its striking marble facade, bronze doors, and mosaic ceiling. It holds a significant place in the spiritual center of Florence, located in Piazza del Duomo and Piazza San Giovanni alongside the Church of Santa Maria del Fiore. The baptistery is considered one of the oldest religious buildings in the city and features exceptional works including three notable bronze doors.

sources.snippet: Make sure to add to your list the "must-see classics" of the Cathedral of Santa Maria del Fiore and the Baptistery. Both will leave you breathless!
sources.shortName: What to Do & See, Most Romantic Places in Florence

places.name: Baptistery of St. John

reviews.text: The Battistero di San Giovanni is one of the oldest buildings in Florence. It is an architectural wonder which apparently took its inspiration from the Pantheon. Even though there is currently restoration work underway, it is well worth visiting.  Beautiful mosaics and bronze doors including the stunning Gates of Paradise.

Beautiful chapel to St. John located right across the street from the Duomo in Florence.  Part of our guided tour, I enjoyed the rich history of this building pointed out by the guide, including the Roman burial area underneath the floor

The Baptistry is the most plain and simple on the outside of all the buildings to see around the Cathedral.

The inside is also fairly plain and the real attraction is in the incredible mosaic ceiling.

Unfortunately while we were there, only a tiny portion off to the side was visible, with the main portion all covered over with sheeting and a huge big scaffold right up the centre.

It's great that they are restoring and keeping the maintenance of these natural treasure up to date, just bad timing it was when we only had 3 days on Florence.

The beautiful marble and stone patterned floors are exquisite.

Still well worth a visit.

places.address: Piazza San Giovanni, 50122 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Boboli Gardens, located behind the Pitti Palace, have been a serene retreat for centuries. The Medici family transformed the gardens into a stunning Italian-style oasis, setting an example for European courts. The open-air museum is adorned with Renaissance statues, fountains like Neptune Fountain and the large Statue of Abundance, and a grand avenue lined with cypress trees and statues leading to Isolotto square.

sources.snippet: Continuing our romantic tour in Florence we arrive at the Boboli Gardens. More than a garden, is one of the green treasures of the city, a real open-air museum: admire the imposing Fountain of Neptune, the Fountain of the Ocean and the romantic eighteenth-century Kaffeehaus hand in hand it will surely be an exciting experience. Not far from our Ad Astra Boutique Hotel, Boboli Gardens has four entrances, and it is possible to visit it by purchasing an entrance ticket.
sources.shortName: Romantic Holiday in Florence

sources.snippet: Walking in the Boboli Gardens for Valentine‚Äôs Day in Florence is a romantic and evocative experience. Among shady paths, scented flowers and ancient statues, lovers can share moments of intimacy and contemplation. The sunset gives the park a magical atmosphere, while the splendid views of the city and the surrounding hills offer a breathtaking spectacle.
sources.shortName: Valentine's Day in Florence: the most romantic places

sources.snippet: The astonishing beauty of the Boboli gardens is sure to mesmerize you with its first look itself. This romantically beautiful garden is a part of the Pitti Palace in Florence. The Boboli garden is full of romantic landscapes and serene escapes with many interesting sculptures behind the Pitti Palace.
sources.shortName: Romantic Places to Visit in Florence

sources.snippet: Escape the bustling city streets and venture into the lush paradise of the Boboli Gardens. Here, among fragrant flowers and hidden paths, you‚Äôll discover an oasis of tranquility. Find a secluded spot beneath the shade of a tree, lay down a blanket, and indulge in a romantic picnic.
sources.siteName: RomeCabs Transfers and Tours in Italy (Rome Cabs)
sources.shortName: 7 Romantic Places in Florence: Unveiling A Lover‚Äôs Paradise

sources.snippet: Among the most romantic places we highly recommend are the most beautiful gardens in Florence: the BOBOLI GARDENS, the GARDEN OF ROSES and THE GARDENS OF VILLA BARDINI, which all offer really fabulous views of the city that you can enjoy at your leisure.
sources.shortName: What to Do & See, Most Romantic Places in Florence

sources.snippet: The beautiful vegetables and glorious cuts of Fiorentina steak will make you wish you had a kitchen, but in any case, you can easily assemble a gourmet picnic to share in the Boboli Gardens or on a bridge overlooking the Arno.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Florence

sources.snippet: Moreover, to live magic moments, we suggest you a sunset stroll along the Arno River and Ponte Vecchio and a visit to the Boboli Gardens, where time seems to stand still in the charm of the green.
sources.shortName: where to sleep and what to do

sources.snippet: In the afternoon, once again on a nature itinerary, head to the Boboli Gardens, where you can stroll among statues, fountains and beautiful avenues.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places and itineraries in Florence
10 romantic things to do in Florence for Valentine's Day

places.name: Boboli Gardens

reviews.text:
Beautiful gardens with tall, ancient trees and lovely paths for a leisurely stroll.

Keep in mind that most of the paths don't have shade, so in summer it can get very hot. Be sure to bring water, a hat, and anything else you might need to stay cool and comfortable.

Really a park, quite steep in places but there are more gently inclining paths to use and shaded tunnels.  I visited 30 years ago and trees have grown up somewhat blocking the view of the duomo from the coffee house (by the way its not a cafe).  Struggled to find another viewpoint in the heat.  Would recommend visiting early in the day or late afternoon in high summer.  Worth going for the view of Florence but that is about all.  10 euro entry fee.

During our vacation in Florence we decided to visit the Boboli Gardens to escape the fuss of the city for one day.
The garden itself is not too big and therefore walkable. Everything you can find here is within 10 minutes walking. There are several public restrooms and plenty of places you can take a pause on a bench. There is also a beautiful view over the Tuscan landscape (I forgot the name of the place where you have this view).

Something people should be aware of is that they are currently renovating certain parts of the garden. For this reason, certain parts are closed or might ruin the experience of a beautiful looking garden. The fountains were not working as well.

Another point that should be pointed out is that everyone (also the people who only visit the garden), will have to go to security (which means you also go through a metal detector).

The only drawback I found is that the employees working here are not that friendly. This is something that had been pointed out by other people as well, so I am not entirely surprised. The employees gave me the feeling that they did not enjoy working here.

The garden was worth seeing but I am not sure whether it is worth a repeat for in the future.

places.address: 50125 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Villa Bardini is a 17th-century villa in Florence that houses artworks by painter Pietro Annigoni and is surrounded by a renowned garden. The villa offers a serene escape from the bustling city, with its manicured gardens providing a stunning backdrop for leisurely strolls. Visitors can wander through wisteria-covered paths and explore the terraced Rose and Iris Gardens, which are part of the UNESCO extension.

sources.snippet: Climb to the very top of the highest points of the city, either the tower of Palazzo Vecchio, called THE ARNOLFO TOWER or BRUNELLESCHI'S DOME or GIOTTO'S BELLTOWER. As soon as you have recovered from the effort of the climb, launch (metaphorically, of course) into a heart-felt declaration of love: it will be an unforgettable moment!
sources.shortName: What to Do & See, Most Romantic Places in Florence

sources.snippet: Walk around the Garden at Villa Bardini for a bit of old-world charm and some great views of the city. Located between the well-known tourist attractions Piazzale Michelangelo and Giardino di Boboli you‚Äôll find the lesser-known Villa Bardini with its romantic garden, a jewel that has not yet been discovered by mass tourism.
sources.shortName: Planning the Perfect Romantic Florence Honeymoon

places.name: Villa Bardini

reviews.text: A beautiful place to spend the morning.  Nice long walk. Winding paths uphill, but not too challenging.  Incredible views from several locations.  Lovely cafe with stunning view at the top!

May 2025. (This is a review for Giardino Bardini. For some reason it's Google maps entry is gone.) Unfortunately we missed the Wisteria bloom by a couple of weeks. It's still a nice place to visit though with great views of the Florence skyline.

Nestled on the south bank of the Arno River, Villa Bardini Gardens is a hidden gem that offers one of the most spectacular experiences in Florence. During my recent visit, I was completely enchanted by this magnificent estate that combines Italian garden design, breathtaking panoramic views, and tranquil ambiance away from the tourist crowds.

The gardens cascade down a hillside offering multiple levels of exploration. The wisteria-covered pergola walkway is absolutely magical - a tunnel of hanging purple blooms creating a scene straight from a fairytale. The well-maintained gravel paths wind through meticulously landscaped terraces featuring vibrant azaleas, classic Italian statuary, and elegant architectural elements.

What truly sets Villa Bardini apart is its unrivaled vantage point overlooking Florence. The panoramic terrace provides a postcard-perfect view of the Duomo, Palazzo Vecchio, and the entire historic center, all framed by the rolling Tuscan hills in the background. This view alone is worth the visit, especially during golden hour when the city is bathed in warm light.

The on-site caf√© offers a delightful place to relax with refreshments while soaking in the surroundings. I particularly appreciated how uncrowded it felt compared to other Florentine attractions, creating an authentic and peaceful atmosphere.

For anyone visiting Florence who wants to experience the perfect combination of natural beauty, artistic landscaping, and breathtaking views, Villa Bardini Gardens is an absolute must-visit destination. It's a place that captures the essence of Tuscany's romantic spirit and will remain etched in your memory long after your visit.‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã

places.address: Costa S. Giorgio, 2, 50125 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Giardino Bardini is a 17th-century villa with two museums and art exhibitions, along with beautiful gardens. While Florence is renowned for its historic sites and art collections, it also boasts well-maintained gardens and parks like Boboli Gardens, Iris and Rose gardens, and the Botanical Garden. Giardino Bardini, a 4-hectare garden recently restored to its original glory, is often overlooked but now gaining attention from locals and visitors alike.

sources.snippet: Every spring, the garden come alive with colorful flowers and a large, hanging purple wisteria which is the perfect backdrop for proposing to your partner while admiring the stunning panorama of Florence below. https://www.instagram.com/p/BGhfi48g0Jt/?. tagged=giardinobardini
sources.shortName: 12 Romantic Spots To Propose In Florence

places.name: Giardino Bardini

reviews.text:
Giardino Bardini is a hidden gem in Florence, offering some of the most breathtaking views of the city. From the terrace, you can enjoy a panoramic vista that includes the Duomo and the Arno River-it's a perfect spot for photos! The gardens themselves are beautifully designed, with well-maintained pathways, lush greenery, and charming nooks to explore. It's a peaceful oasis away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

The history of the garden is fascinating too. It was originally part of the Bardini family's estate and later redesigned in the early 20th century. The blend of Renaissance and Baroque styles is evident throughout, making it a must-visit for anyone interested in Florence's rich heritage.

The garden is open daily from 10:00 AM to 7:00 PM, with the last entry at 6:30 PM. Entry costs ‚Ç¨10 for adults, with discounted tickets available for students and residents. It's definitely worth the visit for both the beautiful gardens and the incredible views!

A very elegant and well kept garden up the riverside of Florence, facing the Duomo, the uffizzi and other important buildings.
We only visited the Bardini garden due to lack of time, but the ‚Ç¨10 ticket also gives access to the Boboli gardens, a larger complex, further up the hill. I am sure that Boboli is as well kept, or even better.
The views of the city from the garden are alone worth the entrance ticket price, but the quiet walk through the garden is also as enjoyable.
The place can be crowded around some panoramic areas, but on the whole, it is usually a peaceful place for one to enjoy, away from the busy streets of Florence.

Beautiful. Worth visiting just for the views.
It is a little off the beaten track but well worth it. Lovely gardens, very peaceful and relaxing. We visited in early April and had the joy of seeing the wisteria corridor. Nice cafe with reasonably priced drinks. Gorgeous views of the city.
Definitely worth a visit.

places.address: Via de' Bardi, 1, 50125 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Embark on an unforgettable journey with "Tuscan Wine Tours With Angie," where you can escape the hustle and bustle of Florence to explore the stunning landscapes of Chianti. This tour takes you through lush vineyards and olive groves, allowing you to visit two prominent wineries in the region. You'll have a chance to delve into the wine-making process by touring cellars and tasting exquisite wines alongside high-quality extra virgin olive oil, complemented by local delicacies.

sources.snippet: A highlight of our trip was a tour of the beautiful Tuscan countryside. We were amazed at just how close Tuscany is to Florence. It only took us a 40-minute drive before we arrived at our first stop.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Things To Do In Florence Italy in 2023

places.name: Tuscan Wine Tours With Angie

reviews.text: We booked the 3 Chianti wineries tour for myself and my husband. We would highly recommend! The tour group was small, 8 people total, and we were transported in a nice air conditioned van. Angela was our tour guide and she was incredible! So knowledgeable about the wine process and answered all of our questions. The three wineries she picked were all small family run wineries with wonderful hospitality. We were the only tour group at each winery, which was hard to believe! All the wine, cheese, and the lunch were tremendous. Such a fabulous experience in the Tuscan countryside.

Fabulous tour, we had an amazing time visiting local wineries,  getting to hear their stories and seeing what they do in a very personalised way. Our guide was Filippo who was extremely knowledgeable about the vineyards, local area and wines in general. Filippo kept everything on track and was a lovely host. We picked this tour as it catered to vegans which most of the others don't. They took so much care over how they planned the day out and looked after the group. An amazing experience from start to finish and would thoroughly recommend.

My husband and I could not have imagined a better experience! Angie was our tour guide and she was amazing! She took us to three small, family owned wineries where we learned about the wine making process. We were able to taste several wines and olive oil at each location, lunch was included at the second winery and it was one of the best meals we had! We loved that the tour size was only up to 8 people, it really made for an intimate experience.  We would recommend this to anyone traveling through Florence!

places.address: Lungarno delle Grazie, 2, 50122 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Villa medicea della Petraia is a historic Medici villa located near Florence, Italy. It served as the summer residence of King Victor Emanuel II of Savoy when Florence was the capital of Italy. The villa features a covered courtyard adorned with frescoes and a romantic garden that visitors can explore. The interior showcases furnishings from the era of the Savoy monarchy, offering a glimpse into its regal past. While reservations are required to enter the old mansion, standby visits may be possible.

sources.snippet: At the point when Florence was the capital of Italy, the Villa Medicea La Petraia was the Most Beautiful Place in Florence. It was the mid-year living arrangement of King Victor Emanuel II of Savoy. In 1919, it turned into the property of the Italian State.
sources.siteName: Explore the World with Adequate Travel - Your One-Stop Destination for Travel Planning-adequatetravel.com
sources.shortName: Best Romantic Things to do in Florence with your Partner

places.name: Villa medicea della Petraia

reviews.text:
Incredible Medici Villa! Worth a short drive or taking a bus and a bit of 20 minutes walk up the north part of Florence. Beautiful and lavish interior. It is self guided tour with foreign language guide using your phone or it is written on each room with a brief description in Italian and English.

Villa La Petraia¬†is one of the¬†Medici villas¬†in Castello,¬†Florence,¬†Tuscany, central¬†Italy. It has a distinctive 19th-century¬†belvedere¬†on the upper east terrace on axis with the view of Florence.

In 1364, the "palace" of Petraia belonged to the Brunelleschi family until in 1422 Palla Strozzi bought it and expanded it by buying the surrounding land.

In the first half of the sixteenth century, the villa became the property of the Salutati, who then sold the villa to Cosimo I de' Medici in 1544, who gave it to his son, Cardinal Ferdinando in 1568. Then from 1588, there was a decade of extensive excavation works which transformed the "stony" nature of the place (hence the name in Petraia, that is full of stones) into dramatic sequence of terraces dominated by the massive main building. It is traditionally attributed to Bernardo Buontalenti, even though the only documented certainty is the presence on site of Raphael Pagni.

The Villa remained in the ownership of the Medici family until their extinction, when it passed to the Grand Dukes of Habsburg-Lorraine. Leopold II laid out the Romantic style garden park to the north, but otherwise few changes were made. From 1860 the estate came into the ownership of the House of Savoy, becoming one of Victor Emmanuel II's favourite residences. During this time the central courtyard was given a glass roof and an aviary was constructed.[1] The villa was transferred to the Italian state in 1919 and is now a museum.
Beautiful place, worth to visit. Both gardens and villa inside are free to visit. The villa has guided yours (hours of tours available on their website).

It's open free to the public.  But inside the villa one has to join a tour (in Italian only).  It's worth it even if you don't understand a word - the frescos in the enclosed courtyard alone is worth it.  The garden has a great view of the valley below and the other Medicean villa at Costello.

places.address: Via della Petraia, 40, 50141 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: La Giostra is a romantic restaurant located in the heart of Florence, just a short walk from Duomo. The stunning interiors feature brick vaulted ceilings adorned with fairy lights and an abundance of plants and flowers, creating a charming atmosphere. Known for serving exquisite Tuscan dishes such as Florentine T-bone steak and an extensive wine selection, this restaurant offers impeccable food that is often regarded as some of the best in Florence.

sources.snippet: We would argue this has to be one of the most romantic restaurants in Florence, Italy. The restaurant is located across two different plots on the same street and is flooded with fairy lights. The tunnel shape restaurant feels super cost and romantic as each table is candle-lit.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Things To Do In Florence Italy in 2023

places.name: La Giostra

reviews.text: A fabulous all around experience visiting La Giostra on our recent trip to Tuscany. We had arrived late to our reservation, so we started at the bar for cocktails in their cozy atmosphere. Drinks were great! As we got seated for our table, you understand how popular, maybe touristy, this restaurant has become. We were presented with handheld complimentary bites for the table, common around here, which were also delicious. Through our dinner service, our favorite entrees included the Pear Ravioli and a Lemon Chicken dish. These were truly incredible. The owner came by to wish my mother Happy Birthday many times and even came to sing with dessert. Such a warm, welcoming restaurant with true Tuscan nature.

Outstanding experience!! Reservations are sometimes tough to get & worth the effort. I had the privilege of speaking to the owner before departure and found him extraordinarily humble & gracious. The restaurant has a warm, inviting atmosphere with candlelit tables & fine linens. Decadent, high quality olive oil & balsamic was a treat for me personally! Our waiter was professional & went above and beyond. I cannot say enough about my meal! I ordered the filet prepared in a rich, thick balsamic glaze. The steak was at least 3‚Äù thick, a healthy 8-12oz & a perfect medium rare!! üëè üëè  La Giostra was my absolute favorite dining experience in Firenze!! Someday I'll return to their beautiful city & will probably make a reservation here for each night of my visit. Thank you for a beautiful dining memory. We really had a wonderful time at your establishment!

Exceptional Italian steakhouse. My wife was recommended this place by 2 separate people who've been to Florence before. The pear ravioli lives up to the hype and the steak was cooked excellently. Outstanding dining experience with good service. Highly suggest booking a reservation for lunch/dinner.

places.address: Borgo Pinti, 16 R, 50121 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Enoteca Pitti Gola e Cantina is a charming wine bar situated across from Palazzo Pitti, offering an extensive selection of Tuscan wines to accompany regional dishes. The elegant venue features marble and stunning woodwork, creating a sophisticated yet unpretentious atmosphere. The wine list is comprehensive, with a focus on Tuscan and Piedmontese varieties, including sought-after labels and expert recommendations for food pairings.

sources.snippet: Continue your walk south of the river to Enoteca Pitti another historic bar that offers curated wine-flights designed to both educate and delight. Toast one another and your romantic Florence adventure: Salute!
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Florence

places.name: Enoteca Pitti Gola e Cantina

reviews.text: One of our favorite stops on our 17 day trip to Italy. We made reservations and had an amazing dinner, and they were OK with us bringing our 2 young children (ages 2 and 6). Its a pretty elegant place, so I wouldn't recommend bringing kids unless they are very well behaved!  We sat outside and enjoyed a couple of sparkling wines they recommended, followed by a tasting of a Barolo and Brunello (to compare).  We loved most of everything we tried to be honest.  We then got some amazing and detailed information about where to go and what to taste later on in our trip into Chianti Classico.  By the end of the trip we were able to validate that the recommendations from Zeno were among the best we received on the whole trip!  We would return in a heart beat, such a great place. We also purchased several wines from them at the end of the night!

Loved this wine bar. Wonderful flights and nice meat and cheese plate. We went twice during our week in Florence and even bought some bottles to take home. I loved how they explained the wines in the flight. Great people watching outside the Palazza Pitti!

This was a great wine bar to go to on a warm day. The decent price includes a wine pairing with your set meal. My husband had the truffle meal and I tried the lighter vegetable option. The wines paired were deep and crisp.

places.address: Piazza de' Pitti, 16, 50125 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Giardino delle Rose is a charming green space located below the popular Piazzale Michelangelo in Florence. This 19th-century rose garden boasts over 400 varieties of roses that bloom beautifully in late spring, creating a fragrant and colorful display. The garden also features a dedicated Japanese garden and aromatic lemon trees, providing a peaceful retreat from the bustling city.

sources.snippet: Located just a fews steps below Piazzale Michelangelo, the Rose Garden is a charming place where you can enjoy fantastic views over Florence while strolling among roses and strange statues created by the Belgian artist Jean-Michel Folon. The garden has plenty of benches where you can sit and admire the panorama before proposing. https://www.instagram.com/p/BZyo-8gB9gc/?
sources.shortName: 12 Romantic Spots To Propose In Florence

places.name: Giardino delle Rose

reviews.text:
This is an absolutely lovely spot, perfect for a picnic! Bring a blanket, buy a takeaway pizza, and enjoy the beautiful view over Florence. It's a great place for a first date.

There's live music coming from the caf√© above, which adds to the relaxed vibe. You can buy drinks there (an Aperol Spritz in a plastic cup was ‚Ç¨7) and bring them down to the park. They also sell water refills for ‚Ç¨2, so bring your own bottle if you can.

Just a heads-up: the park closes at 8 PM sharp, and they do lock the gates - we know a few people who got to learn this the hard way.
Gorgeous displays of numerous different roses. Lovely views over the Arno to the city and cute cameo views of the Duomo. But not as magnificent as those in England.

Very large and lovely garden which comprises of multiple gardens and lovely sites in Florence. I got tired of walking at a point so didn't get the full view of the location. Will definitely recommend you give atleast 4hours to explore this holistically

places.address: Viale Giuseppe Poggi, 2, 50125 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Semel Street Food is a tiny sandwich shop located near the Sant'Ambrogio market in Florence. The shop, run by Marco Paparozzis, offers a variety of soft white panini with unique fillings that change daily and are listed on a blackboard.

sources.snippet: To taste the best of what the market has to offer, head to Semel, a sandwich shop so good it made a list of a Top 10 Florence Attractions.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Florence

places.name: Semel Street Food

reviews.text: Possibly the best sandwich I've ever eaten, washed down with an excellent 1euro glass of house red wine. An interesting and unusual choice on the menu, you'll want to try more than one. This felt like a spot for locals but it was also recommended in a certain well known guide book. Absolutely fantastic.

Some of the simplest experiences can be amongst the best‚Ä¶..like getting a ham, cheese & tomato sandwich served  on a fresh crusty bread roll, from a tiny modest store in an obscure location near a market Florence.   Served by the outgoing and personality-filled owner Marco himself, it was a delicious sandwich but an even more memorable experience.   The ‚Ç¨1 glass of rather ordinary wine was the icing on a very fun cake.   Definitely worth visiting.
The sandwich is delicious and simple. Semel the owner is awesome, so friendly and helpful. Very affordable sandwich and the ‚Ç¨1 wine goes so well with the sandwich.

places.address: Piazza Lorenzo Ghiberti, 44/r, 50122 Firenze FI, Italy

places.generalDescription: Il Santo Bevitore is a charming Tuscan restaurant located in Florence, offering a refined dining experience in a traditional setting with vaulted ceilings, brick walls, and wooden beams adorned with wine shelves. The menu features a delightful selection of meats, cheeses, marinated vegetables, pastas, and non-traditional yet deliciously prepared meats. The restaurant prides itself on using fresh and locally sourced ingredients to create Mediterranean-inspired dishes that change with the seasons.

sources.snippet: Il Santo Bevitore (Via Santo Spirito, 64r) mixes artistry with elegance. The food is really something special‚Äîyou must try the terrine of poultry fegatini (livers) with sweet wine sauce. The location in Oltrarno is absolutely perfect.
sources.shortName: 6 Romantic Restaurants in Florence for the Perfect Date Night

places.name: Il Santo Bevitore

reviews.text: Had a very good dinner here, very busy and loud and dark, service was spot on. We had pasta, polpo, flan, all very high quality. Food was served very quick, a bit surprising for Italy. Great wine list.

We had a nice dinner in this restaurant. Reservation highly recommended. Food was super good. The octopus was my personal highlight. The Tatar was for my taste a little bit ‚Äúboring‚Äù. Service was top. Overall a good experience and highly recommended.

We absolutely love this spots for locals. Had such an amazing lunch that we returned to their wine bar next door and for dinner. It gets packed so go early. Great service - filled with locals which we love. If they are packed and you have to wait you can grab a bottle of wine next door at their wine bar. Worth the wait!!

places.address: Via Santo Spirito, 64r, 50125 Firenze FI, Italy
